title: Opinions on Ryze Jungle
body:
I'm wondering what anyone thinks about this. 

I saw him make a little bit of a showing in the jungle when when his most recent rework hit, and I felt like he was pretty strong, but that seems to have disappeared completely. 

Now that the jungle has changed more in preseason, I actually think he should be a little stronger, but still nothing. 

I definitely understand that there are plenty of strong junglers at the moment, and Ryze would certainly not be among top tier, so is that why he is overlooked completely?

If anyone has tried Ryze Jungle out recently, let me know what you think of him. 

If you haven't, maybe give him a shot and see how it goes.

replies.body: im not sure how his clear would go

> [{quoted}](name=RÃ²ssy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UksrGE5P,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-16T11:58:16.122+0000)
>
> im not sure how his clear would go

First might not be great. 

Second should be decent. 

Beyond second he should be a monster.
thats the thing tho, how will he manage the first clear without falling far behind? be up against a vi/shyv or so, that punishment might be too much
I think the new jungle just made mages suck

> [{quoted}](name=regaline,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UksrGE5P,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-16T12:21:03.944+0000)
>
> I think the new jungle just made mages suck

Idk, he has a pretty strong multi-target and single target combo. 

Multi-target really just involves spreading his Spell Flux and using Q to nuke everything at once. Using E, E, Q, or W, E, Q would also give him the shield and movement speed to kite/shed the damage from these camps. 

Single target; Q, E, Q, W, Q, AA, E, Q. 
Past the second clear, Gromp, Red, and Blue should be dead by the end of this combo, if not before.

I think he'd be too squishy, too mana hungry early game once his blue runs out, and ganks would be weird.

I think I did see it in a Bjergsen video tho. He did alright.
